segment.source: MD Conversion - Use policies to manage computers and mobile devices with Microsoft Intune
segment.target: MD Conversion - Use policies to manage computers and mobile devices with Microsoft Intune

segment.source: MD Conversion - Use policies to manage computers and mobile devices with Microsoft Intune
segment.target: MD Conversion - Use policies to manage computers and mobile devices with Microsoft Intune

segment.source: Policies are groups of settings that control features on mobile devices and computers.
segment.target: Policies are groups of settings that control features on mobile devices and computers.

segment.source: You create policies using templates that contain recommended or customized settings, and then deploy them to device or user groups.
segment.target: You create policies using templates that contain recommended or customized settings, and then deploy them to device or user groups.

segment.source: How to create configuration policies
segment.target: How to create configuration policies

segment.source: The way you create policies differs depending on the policy type you are creating.
segment.target: The way you create policies differs depending on the policy type you are creating.

segment.source: These procedures cover creating configuration policies.
segment.target: These procedures cover creating configuration policies.

segment.source: To help choose the right policy for your needs, see Manage settings and features on your devices with Microsoft Intune policies.
segment.target: To help choose the right policy for your needs, see Manage settings and features on your devices with Microsoft Intune policies.

segment.source: For information about creating compliance policies, see Manage device compliance policies for Microsoft Intune.
segment.target: For information about creating compliance policies, see Manage device compliance policies for Microsoft Intune.

segment.source: For information about creating conditional access policies, see Manage access to email and SharePoint with Microsoft Intune.
segment.target: For information about creating conditional access policies, see Manage access to email and SharePoint with Microsoft Intune.

segment.source: For information about corporate device enrollment policies, see Set up iOS and Mac management with Microsoft Intune.
segment.target: For information about corporate device enrollment policies, see Set up iOS and Mac management with Microsoft Intune.

segment.source: To create a policy
segment.target: To create a policy

segment.source: In the Microsoft Intune administration console, click Policy > Configuration Policies > Add.
segment.target: In the Microsoft Intune administration console, click Policy > Configuration Policies > Add.

segment.source: Choose the policy you want, choose to use the recommended settings for the policy (when available; you can change these settings later), or to create a custom policy with your own settings.
segment.target: Choose the policy you want, choose to use the recommended settings for the policy (when available; you can change these settings later), or to create a custom policy with your own settings.

segment.source: For help choosing the right policy, see Manage settings and features on your devices with Microsoft Intune policies.
segment.target: For help choosing the right policy, see Manage settings and features on your devices with Microsoft Intune policies.

segment.source: When you are ready, click Create Policy.
segment.target: When you are ready, click Create Policy.

segment.source: On the Create Policy screen, configure a name and optional description for the policy.
segment.target: On the Create Policy screen, configure a name and optional description for the policy.

segment.source: Configure the required policy settings, then click Save Policy.
segment.target: Configure the required policy settings, then click Save Policy.

segment.source: In the confirmation dialog box, click Yes to deploy the policy now, or click No to create the policy without deploying it.
segment.target: In the confirmation dialog box, click Yes to deploy the policy now, or click No to create the policy without deploying it.

segment.source: You can view and edit the new policy by browsing the sections for each policy type in Policy workspace.
segment.target: You can view and edit the new policy by browsing the sections for each policy type in Policy workspace.

segment.source: When you create a policy that uses the recommended settings, the name of the new policy is a combination of the template name, date, and time.
segment.target: When you create a policy that uses the recommended settings, the name of the new policy is a combination of the template name, date, and time.

segment.source: When you edit the policy, the name updates with the time and date of the edit.
segment.target: When you edit the policy, the name updates with the time and date of the edit.

segment.source: Now that you have created a policy, you will typically want to deploy it to one or more groups of users or devices.
segment.target: Now that you have created a policy, you will typically want to deploy it to one or more groups of users or devices.

segment.source: You don't deploy all policy types.
segment.target: You don't deploy all policy types.

segment.source: For example, the mobile application management policy is not deployed.
segment.target: For example, the mobile application management policy is not deployed.

segment.source: This policy type is instead associated with an app, which you then deploy.
segment.target: This policy type is instead associated with an app, which you then deploy.

segment.source: To deploy a policy
segment.target: To deploy a policy

segment.source: In the Policy workspace, select the policy you want to deploy, then click Manage Deployment.
segment.target: In the Policy workspace, select the policy you want to deploy, then click Manage Deployment.

segment.source: In the Manage Deployment dialog box:
segment.target: In the Manage Deployment dialog box:

segment.source: To deploy the policy - Select one or more groups to which you want to deploy the policy, then click Add > OK.
segment.target: To deploy the policy - Select one or more groups to which you want to deploy the policy, then click Add > OK.

segment.source: To close the dialog box without deploying it - Click Cancel.
segment.target: To close the dialog box without deploying it - Click Cancel.

segment.source: When you select a deployed policy, you can view further information about the deployment in the lower part of the policies list.
segment.target: When you select a deployed policy, you can view further information about the deployment in the lower part of the policies list.

segment.source: To manage policies you have already created
segment.target: To manage policies you have already created

segment.source: In the Microsoft Intune administration console, click Policy, then browse to and select the policy you want to manage.
segment.target: In the Microsoft Intune administration console, click Policy, then browse to and select the policy you want to manage.

segment.source: Select one of the actions in the following table:
segment.target: Select one of the actions in the following table:

segment.source: Action
segment.target: Action

segment.source: More information
segment.target: More information

segment.source: Edit
segment.target: Edit

segment.source: Opens the properties for the selected policy to allow you to make changes.
segment.target: Opens the properties for the selected policy to allow you to make changes.

segment.source: Delete
segment.target: Delete

segment.source: Deletes the selected policy.
segment.target: Deletes the selected policy.

segment.source: When you delete a policy, it is removed from all groups to which it was deployed.
segment.target: When you delete a policy, it is removed from all groups to which it was deployed.

segment.source: What happens when a policy is deleted, or no longer applicable
segment.target: What happens when a policy is deleted, or no longer applicable

segment.source: Manage Deployment
segment.target: Manage Deployment

segment.source: In the Manage Deployment dialog box, select the group you want to deploy the policy to and click Add.
segment.target: In the Manage Deployment dialog box, select the group you want to deploy the policy to and click Add.

segment.source: Tasks for Intune policies
segment.target: Tasks for Intune policies

segment.source: To refresh the policies on a device to ensure they are current (applies to computers only)
segment.target: To refresh the policies on a device to ensure they are current (applies to computers only)

segment.source: In the Microsoft Intune administration console, click Groups, and then select a device group.
segment.target: In the Microsoft Intune administration console, click Groups, and then select a device group.

segment.source: Select the devices on which you want to refresh the policies, and then click Remote Tasks > Refresh Policies.
segment.target: Select the devices on which you want to refresh the policies, and then click Remote Tasks > Refresh Policies.

segment.source: Click Remote Tasks in the bottom-right corner of the window to check the task status.
segment.target: Click Remote Tasks in the bottom-right corner of the window to check the task status.

segment.source: More information about Intune policies
segment.target: More information about Intune policies

segment.source: How long does it take for mobile devices to get policy or apps after they have been deployed?
segment.target: How long does it take for mobile devices to get policy or apps after they have been deployed?

segment.source: When a policy or app is deployed, immediately begins attempting to notify the device that it should check-in with the service.
segment.target: When a policy or app is deployed, immediately begins attempting to notify the device that it should check-in with the service.

segment.source: This typically takes less than 5 minutes.
segment.target: This typically takes less than 5 minutes.

segment.source: If a device doesn't check in to get policy after the first notification is sent, 3 more attempts are made.
segment.target: If a device doesn't check in to get policy after the first notification is sent, 3 more attempts are made.

segment.source: If the device is offline (for example, it is turned off, or not connected to a network) then it might not receive the notifications.
segment.target: If the device is offline (for example, it is turned off, or not connected to a network) then it might not receive the notifications.

segment.source: In this case, the device will get policy on its next scheduled check-in with the service as follows:
segment.target: In this case, the device will get policy on its next scheduled check-in with the service as follows:

segment.source: Platform
segment.target: Platform

segment.source: Check-in frequency after initial notification
segment.target: Check-in frequency after initial notification

segment.source: iOS
segment.target: iOS

segment.source: Every 6 hours
segment.target: Every 6 hours

segment.source: Android
segment.target: Android

segment.source: Every 8 hours
segment.target: Every 8 hours

segment.source: Windows Phone
segment.target: Windows Phone

segment.source: Every 8 hours
segment.target: Every 8 hours

segment.source: Windows PCs enrolled as devices
segment.target: Windows PCs enrolled as devices

segment.source: Every 24 hours
segment.target: Every 24 hours

segment.source: If the device has just enrolled the check-in frequency will be more frequent as follows:
segment.target: If the device has just enrolled the check-in frequency will be more frequent as follows:

segment.source: Platform
segment.target: Platform

segment.source: Frequency
segment.target: Frequency

segment.source: iOS
segment.target: iOS

segment.source: Every 15 minutes for 6 hours and then every 6 hours
segment.target: Every 15 minutes for 6 hours and then every 6 hours

segment.source: Android
segment.target: Android

segment.source: Every 3 minutes for 15 minutes then every 15 minutes for 2 hours, and then every 8 hours
segment.target: Every 3 minutes for 15 minutes then every 15 minutes for 2 hours, and then every 8 hours

segment.source: Windows Phone
segment.target: Windows Phone

segment.source: Every 5 minutes for 15 minutes then every 15 minutes for 2 hours, and then every 8 hours
segment.target: Every 5 minutes for 15 minutes then every 15 minutes for 2 hours, and then every 8 hours

segment.source: Windows PCs enrolled as devices
segment.target: Windows PCs enrolled as devices

segment.source: Every 3 minutes for 30 minutes, and then every 24 hours
segment.target: Every 3 minutes for 30 minutes, and then every 24 hours

segment.source: Users can also launch the Company Portal app and sync the device to immediately check for policy anytime.
segment.target: Users can also launch the Company Portal app and sync the device to immediately check for policy anytime.

segment.source: What actions cause Intune to immediately send notification to a device?
segment.target: What actions cause Intune to immediately send notification to a device?

segment.source: Devices check in with either when they receive a notification telling them to check-in, or during their regularly scheduled check-in as shown in the tables above.
segment.target: Devices check in with either when they receive a notification telling them to check-in, or during their regularly scheduled check-in as shown in the tables above.

segment.source: When you target a device or user specifically with an action such as a wipe, lock, passcode reset, app deployment, profile deployment (WiFi, VPN, e-mail, etc.), or policy deployment, will immediately begin trying to notify the device that it should check-in with the Intune service to receive these updates.
segment.target: When you target a device or user specifically with an action such as a wipe, lock, passcode reset, app deployment, profile deployment (WiFi, VPN, e-mail, etc.), or policy deployment, will immediately begin trying to notify the device that it should check-in with the Intune service to receive these updates.

segment.source: Other changes such as revising the contact information in the company portal do not cause an immediate notification to devices.
segment.target: Other changes such as revising the contact information in the company portal do not cause an immediate notification to devices.

segment.source: If multiple policies are deployed to the same user or device how do I know which settings will get applied?
segment.target: If multiple policies are deployed to the same user or device how do I know which settings will get applied?

segment.source: It’s important to know that when two or more policies are deployed to the same user or device the evaluation for which setting is applied is done at the individual setting level.
segment.target: It’s important to know that when two or more policies are deployed to the same user or device the evaluation for which setting is applied is done at the individual setting level.

segment.source: Compliance policy settings always have precedence over configuration policy settings
segment.target: Compliance policy settings always have precedence over configuration policy settings

segment.source: The most restrictive compliance policy setting is applied if evaluated against the same setting in a different compliance policy
segment.target: The most restrictive compliance policy setting is applied if evaluated against the same setting in a different compliance policy

segment.source: The most restrictive configuration policy setting is applied if evaluated against the same setting in a different configuration policy
segment.target: The most restrictive configuration policy setting is applied if evaluated against the same setting in a different configuration policy

segment.source: What happens when mobile application management (MAM) policies conflict with each other?
segment.target: What happens when mobile application management (MAM) policies conflict with each other?

segment.source: Which one will be applied to the app?
segment.target: Which one will be applied to the app?

segment.source: Conflict values are the most restrictive settings available in a mobile application management policy, except for the number entry fields (like PIN attempts before reset).
segment.target: Conflict values are the most restrictive settings available in a mobile application management policy, except for the number entry fields (like PIN attempts before reset).

segment.source: The number entry fields will be set to the same as the values as if you create a MAM policy in the console using the recommended settings option.
segment.target: The number entry fields will be set to the same as the values as if you create a MAM policy in the console using the recommended settings option.

segment.source: Conflicts occur when two policy settings are the same.
segment.target: Conflicts occur when two policy settings are the same.

segment.source: For example, you configured two MAM policies that are identical except for the copy/paste setting.
segment.target: For example, you configured two MAM policies that are identical except for the copy/paste setting.

segment.source: In this scenario, the copy/paste setting will be set to the most restrictive value, but the rest of the settings will be applied as configured.
segment.target: In this scenario, the copy/paste setting will be set to the most restrictive value, but the rest of the settings will be applied as configured.

segment.source: If one policy is deployed to the app and takes effect, and then a second one is deployed, the first one deployed will take precedence and stay applied, while the second shows in conflict.
segment.target: If one policy is deployed to the app and takes effect, and then a second one is deployed, the first one deployed will take precedence and stay applied, while the second shows in conflict.

segment.source: However, if they are both applied at the same time, meaning that there is no preceding policy, then they will both be in conflict, and any conflicting settings will be set to the most restrictive values.
segment.target: However, if they are both applied at the same time, meaning that there is no preceding policy, then they will both be in conflict, and any conflicting settings will be set to the most restrictive values.

segment.source: What happens when iOS custom policies conflict?
segment.target: What happens when iOS custom policies conflict?

segment.source: Intune does not evaluate the payload of Apple Configuration files or custom OMA-URI policy, it merely serves as the delivery mechanism.
segment.target: Intune does not evaluate the payload of Apple Configuration files or custom OMA-URI policy, it merely serves as the delivery mechanism.

segment.source: Therefore, when you deploy a custom policy, ensure the settings configured do not conflict with compliance, configuration or other custom policies.
segment.target: Therefore, when you deploy a custom policy, ensure the settings configured do not conflict with compliance, configuration or other custom policies.

segment.source: In the case of a custom policy with settings conflicts, the order in which are settings are applied is random.
segment.target: In the case of a custom policy with settings conflicts, the order in which are settings are applied is random.

segment.source: What happens when a policy is deleted, or no longer applicable
segment.target: What happens when a policy is deleted, or no longer applicable

segment.source: When you delete a policy, or remove a device from a group to which a policy was deployed, the policy and settings will be removed from the device according to the following tables:
segment.target: When you delete a policy, or remove a device from a group to which a policy was deployed, the policy and settings will be removed from the device according to the following tables:

segment.target: Mobile devices

segment.target: Policy type

segment.source: Endpoint Protection settings
segment.target: Endpoint Protection settings

segment.source: Settings are restored to their recommended values.
segment.target: Settings are restored to their recommended values.

segment.source: The only exception is the setting Join Microsoft Active Protection Service for which the default value is No.
segment.target: The only exception is the setting Join Microsoft Active Protection Service for which the default value is No.

segment.source: For details, see Help secure Windows PCs with Endpoint Protection for Microsoft Intune.
segment.target: For details, see Help secure Windows PCs with Endpoint Protection for Microsoft Intune.

segment.source: Software updates settings
segment.target: Software updates settings

segment.source: Settings are reset to the default state for the operating system.
segment.target: Settings are reset to the default state for the operating system.

segment.source: For details, see Keep Windows PCs up to date with software updates in Microsoft Intune.
segment.target: For details, see Keep Windows PCs up to date with software updates in Microsoft Intune.

segment.source: settings
segment.target: settings

segment.source: Any support contact information that was configured by the policy is deleted from computers.
segment.target: Any support contact information that was configured by the policy is deleted from computers.

segment.source: Windows Firewall settings
segment.target: Windows Firewall settings

segment.source: Settings are reset to the default for the computer operating system.
segment.target: Settings are reset to the default for the computer operating system.

segment.source: For details, see Help secure Windows PCs with Endpoint Protection for Microsoft Intune.
segment.target: For details, see Help secure Windows PCs with Endpoint Protection for Microsoft Intune.
